verse: सुनु सिय सत्य असीस हमारी। पूजिहि मन कामना तुम्हारी॥
explanation: This verse is from 'Balkand'. Rishi Vishwamitra gives this blessing to Sita.
conclusion: A favorable result is indicated. Your heartfelt wishes will be fulfilled by divine grace.

verse: प्रबिसि नगर कीजे सब काजा। हृदयँ राखि कोसलपुर राजा॥
explanation: This verse is from 'Sunderkand'. Hanuman says this to himself before entering Lanka.
conclusion: Success is certain. Begin your work with full faith, keeping the Lord in your heart.

verse: उघरहिं बिमल बिलोचन ही के। मिटहिं दोष दुख भव रजनी के॥
explanation: This verse is from 'Balkand'. It describes the effect of having a vision of Lord Rama.
conclusion: Your path will become clear. Troubles and sorrows will come to an end, leading to success.

verse: बिधि बस सुजन कुसंगत परहीं। फनि मनि सम निज गुन अनुसरहीं॥
explanation: This verse from 'Balkand' explains that even good people can fall into bad company, but they retain their inherent virtues.
conclusion: There is a risk of being influenced by negative company. Be cautious and stay true to your own principles.

verse: होइहि सोइ जो राम रचि राखा। को करि तर्क बढ़ावै साखा॥
explanation: This verse from 'Balkand' is a teaching from Lord Shiva to Parvati about destiny.
conclusion: Have faith and do not worry excessively. What is destined to happen, will happen. Surrender to the divine will.

verse: मुद मंगलमय संत समाजू। जो जग जंगम तीरथराजू॥
explanation: This verse from 'Balkand' praises the company of saints.
conclusion: You will benefit from associating with good, wise people. Success is indicated through noble connections.

verse: गरल सुधा रिपु करहिं मिताई। गोपद सिंधु अनल सितलाई॥
explanation: This verse from 'Sunderkand' describes the miracles that happen with Lord Rama's grace.
conclusion: A highly favorable outcome. With divine grace, all obstacles will vanish and adversaries will become allies.

verse: सुफल मनोरथ होहिंगे तुम्हारे। रामु लखनु सुनि भए सुखारे॥
explanation: This verse is from 'Balkand', spoken by the sage.
conclusion: This is a very positive sign. Your efforts will be successful, and your wishes will be granted.

verse: का चुप साधि रहा बलवाना। पवन तनय बल पवन समाना॥
explanation: From 'Kishkindhakand', Jambavan reminds Hanuman of his forgotten strength.
conclusion: You possess the required strength and ability but are hesitating. Realize your potential and act; success will be yours.
